{{Location Intro|description=<p>{{If Self|Portus Anticus|It|Portus Anticus}} was once the royal port of [[Remuria]]; it has since sunk into an underwater cavern. In its prime, it had a lofty belltower, and the sound of its bells could "pierce the barrier of ocean" to guide sailors home.<ref>{{Ref/VP|Where Only the Bell Tolls}}</ref><ref name="History">{{Ref/Book|The History of the Decline and Fall of Remuria}}</ref></p>}}

It once held [[Remus]]' prized imperial ship, the Fortuna.<ref name="History" />

===Interactables===
====Ancient Engravings #1====
<center>You coveted the glory of Lugdunensis, and yet razed the city to the ground, fashioning shackles for her:<br><!--
-->Faunus, just what manner of barbarian damsel shall be your spoils of war after you murdered her lover,<br><!--
-->What manner of youth oils your body with luxurious perfumes while filling your cup with fine Biturian wine,<br><!--
-->Since the inevitable death following your footsteps has finally caught you, plunging with you into eternal decay?</center>

====Ancient Engravings #2====
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Ancient Engravings:''' "...By order of Legio V's special envoy, Faunus, the northern harbor defensive line has been withdrawn, and defenses have been set up in the direction of [[Caesareum Palace]] in their place..."
:'''Ancient Engravings:''' "...The flank is to be defended by Legio IX. It is only necessary to ensure that there is no frontal breakthrough... (indiscernible) has dispatched several centuries of troops... Unlike the scheming savages, the Dragonborn use no tactics. Merely..."
{{Dialogue End}}

====Ancient Engravings #3====
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Ancient Engravings:''' "...By order of Dominus [[Boethius]], the exalted Harmost, and in accord with the most sacred, beneficent melody of our great [[Remus|Sebastos]], Legio V Orchestrae Excitator is to cease all hostile actions against the Dragonborn from today forth, and return to Caesareum Palace immediately..."
:'''Ancient Engravings:''' "Once the Dragonborn have passed through, Legio VII Caelicantica and Legio IX Benedicti Praecones shall reinforce this position and seal Portus Anticus against northern barbarian attacks, which might otherwise disturb talks..."
{{Dialogue End}}
